column4: Hi I need your help please. My eyes are exploding any minute now. I cant seem to get ubuntu to understand that my monitor is capable of handling refresh rates above 0Hz :)
: try "X -configure" at commandline
I've tried dpkg-reconfigure xserver-conf. I got that advide from the ubuntu forum. Is that the same?
: no, it isn't the same... it calculates all your displayable modes and creates you a new xorg.conf file
ok. I'll give it a try.
: While the other command reconfigures the xserver-xorg package
It didnt work. Am I allowed to paste the output in here?
: terminal window : sudo X -configure
: I just went thru your problem today... tried "dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg" first, didn't fix it... then "X -configure" worked, I now have *all* possible video modes/resolutions in my menus
I did... it didn't work. "fatal error" and so on
I could paste them to you if you want?
: use pastebin --> paste.ubuntu.com
ok, hold on
http://paste.ubuntu.com/94647/
: that was my fault... do it from a failsafe terminal (select sessions at login screen, failsafe terminal)
: It reconfigures your X server (what displays your desktop/panels/etc. and can't be done while it's running (now)
ok. I'll give it a go. Thanks in advanced. I let you know if I succeeds :)
: You'll likey need "sudo" for taht if I remember right
ok
: please do, cuz i just dealt with that *today*
It didn't work. It complained about my X server and then it said that it couldnt found my monitor.
My xorg.conf looks really... hmm... thin to say the least. http://paste.ubuntu.com/94657/
